base.extract_clean_profile: Whether to run the pipeline module to obtain a profile from a clean image of the source
base.process_rave_fit: Whether to run the pipeline module to process/save a profile from an existing rave fit
base.run_frank: Whether to run the pipeline module to perform a (1D or 1+1D) frank fit
base.aspect_ratio_fig: Whether to generate a figure showing frank vertical inference results
base.profile_compare: Whether to generate figures comparing the clean, rave, frank brightness and visibility profiles, and images
base.survey_summary_txt: Whether to generate a .txt file containing the clean, rave, frank best-fit brightness profiles for all sources
base.survey_summary_fig: Whether to generate a figure showing the clean, rave, frank best-fit brightness profiles for all sources

clean.robust: Robust weighting parameter value for clean and rave analysis, results processing
clean.rmax: Maximum radius for clean image profile extraction [arcsec]
clean.Nr: Number of radial bins for clean image profile extraction
clean.Nphi: Number of azimuthal bins for clean image profile extraction

frank.rout: Maximum disc radius in the fit (best to overestimate size of source) [arcsec]
frank.N: Number of collocation points used in the fit (suggested range 100 - 300)
frank.alpha: Order parameter for the power spectrum's inverse Gamma prior (suggested range 1.00 - 1.50). If a list, multiple fits will be performed
frank.wsmooth: Strength of smoothing applied to the power spectrum (suggested range 10^-4 - 10^-1). If a list, multiple fits will be performed
frank.method: The fit method: 'Normal' to fit in linear brighness, 'LogNormal' to fit in logarithmic brightness
frank.I_scale: Minimum brightness for frank fit, used for LogNormal model
frank.set_fstar: Source for visibility amplitude treated as unresolved stellar emission. One of ['MCMC', 'SED', 'custom']
frank.scale_heights: List of `start`, `stop`, `num` for `np.logspace` call to define scale-height grid over which to run fits. E.g., `[-2, -1, 3]` corresponds to `np.logspace(-2, -1, 3)`
frank.nthreads: Number of CPU threads on which to run multiple fits (note a single frank fit is fastest on only 1 thread)
frank.save_profile_fit: Whether to save fitted brightness profile
frank.save_vis_fit: Whether to save fitted visibility distribution
frank.save_uvtables: Whether to save fitted and residual UV tables (these are reprojected)
frank.make_quick_fig: Whether to make a figure showing basic results of the fit

plot.bin_widths: Bin widths in which to bin the observed visibilities. List of float or int [\lambda]
